title: Misty conditions expected in several areas during the morning
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Rathnapura districts in the evening or night.

title: Zelensky vows to ‘make things right’ with Trump and negotiate peace
byline: Volodymyr Zelensky said he was ready to work under Donald Trump’s “strong leadership” to achieve a lasting peace days after their explosive Oval Office meeting.

title: Three arrested for possessing vehicles with fake number plates
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for the possession of used vehicles that were imported duty-free and fitted with fake number plates.

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs. 69 million recovered in Vaththirayan
byline: A coordinated search operation mounted by the Sri Lanka Navy and Police STF has led to the recovery of about 174kg and 126g of Kerala cannabis from the beach vicinity of Vaththirayan in Kilinochchi, Jaffna on Tuesday (04).

title: Several roads in Yala National Park to reopen starting today
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation says that steps will be taken to reopen a limited number of roads in Yala National Park, which have been temporarily closed to tourists, starting today (March 5).

title: Foreigner arrested with over 5kg Kush cannabis at BIA
byline: A foreign national was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning (05) by officers of the Customs Narcotics Control Unit for smuggling Kush cannabis estimated to be worth around Rs. 52 million.

title: 12 killed, 30 wounded in Pakistan military base attack launched by suicide bombers
byline: Two suicide bombings breached a wall at a military base in northwestern Pakistan before other attackers stormed the compound and were repelled in violence that killed at least 12 people and wounded 30 others, according to officials and a local hospital.

title: INS Kuthar strengthens maritime ties with Sri Lanka during Colombo visit
byline: In a significant move to bolster maritime cooperation, Indian Navy Ship (INS) Kuthar, a frontline warship of the Eastern Fleet operating under the Eastern Naval Command, has arrived at Colombo, Sri Lanka, as part of its mission deployment in the Indian Ocean Region.

title: Govt to introduce contributory pension scheme for tourism sector employees
byline: Deputy Minister of Tourism Ruwan Chaminda Ranasinghe has announced that a contributory pension scheme will be introduced this year for individuals engaged in the tourism sector.

title: EC begins preparations for LG polls
byline: The Election Commission has commenced preliminary preparations following the announcement of nominations for the upcoming Local Government Elections.

title: CID to investigate mysterious death of journalist’s husband
byline: Mount Lavinia Additional Magistrate Hemali Halpandeniya has assigned further investigations into the mysterious death of a journalist’s husband to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Indian PM Narendra Modi to visit Sri Lanka in April – report
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to travel to Sri Lanka in April.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa’s grandmother Daisy Forest arrested
byline: Daisy Forest, also known as “Daisy Achchi,” the maternal grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, was questioned by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning in connection with investigations into a money laundering case.

title: Substandard coconut oil found in market, says Trade Minister
byline: Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe says that substandard coconut oil, which is unsuitable for consumption, is available in the market.

title: Overseas travel ban on Pastor Jerome lifted
byline: The overseas travel ban imposed on Pastor Jerome Fernando has been lifted by court.

title: Trump vows to press ahead on reshaping America in speech to Congress
byline: US President Donald Trump vowed Tuesday to keep up his campaign of “swift and unrelenting action” in reorienting the nation’s economy, immigration and foreign policy in an unyielding address before Congress that left Democratic legislators to register their dissent with stone faces, placards calling out “lies,” and one legislator’s ejection.

title: Adrien Brody scores Olivier nomination after Oscar win
byline: US star Adrien Brody has been nominated for the UK’s most prestigious theatre awards, the Oliviers, just days after being named best actor at the Oscars.

title: Back-to-back earthquakes shake India’s Manipur
byline: Two consecutive earthquakes, including one of 5.7 magnitude, rocked Manipur on Wednesday and the tremors were felt across the Northeast, officials said.

title: Yoshitha’s grandmother Daisy Forest granted bail
byline: Daisy Forest, also known as “Daisy Achchi,” the maternal grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, has been granted bail after she was produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court today (05).

title: Suspected shooter in Middeniya triple homicide arrested
byline: Police have arrested the suspected gunman in connection with the recent triple homicide in Middeniya, in which the father and his two children were shot dead while riding on a motorcycle.

title: Federation of Health Professionals calls off strike
byline: The Federation of Health Professionals has decided to temporarily call off its planned token strike, which was scheduled to be launched tomorrow (06).

title: Derailment disrupts train services on several lines
byline: A train has reportedly derailed near the Slave Island railway station (Kompannavidiya).

title: Fire breaks out at shop in Bankshall Street
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out in a shop located on Bankshall Street in Pettah.

title: Reward increased for traffic police officers detecting violations
byline: Acting IGP Priyantha Weerasuriya has issued a circular to increase the reward by 25% for traffic police personnel who detect traffic violations.

title: President assures structural reforms in Sri Lanka Customs to align with modern era
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that structural reforms will be implemented within Sri Lanka Customs to establish an institutional framework that aligns with contemporary needs.

title: Former Minister Mervyn Silva arrested
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).
